title.rendered: Zimbabwe vs West Indies, 2nd Test, 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Zimbabwe: Innocent Kaia, Tanunurwa Makoni, Chamu Chibhabha, Craig Ervine (c), Gary Ballance, Tafadzwa Tsiga (wk), Brandon Mavuta, Wellington Masakadza, Brad Evans, Victor Nyauchi, Richard Ngarava

West Indies: Kraigg Brathwaite (c), Tagenarine Chanderpaul, Raymon Reifer, Jermaine Blackwood, Kyle Mayers, Roston Chase, Joshua Da Silva (wk), Jason Holder, Alzarri Joseph, Gudakesh Motie, Kemar Roach

Venue: Queens Sports Club, Bulawayo

Pitch Report

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 331

2nd innings average score: 329

3rd innings average score: 292

4th innings average score: 225

Wickets per innings: 8

Type: Good batting wicket

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: —

Also Read:

Ireland vs England, Women’s T20 World Cup, Fantasy Tips

South Africa vs New Zealand, Women’s T20 World Cup, 2023: Fantasy Tips

Fantasy Tips of The Day

In only 4 Tests against West Indies, Gary Balance has accumulated 486 runs at 81, including two hundreds and as many fifties.

Craig Ervine averages only 21 against West Indies but has collected 400 runs at 33 including the highest score of 146 in Bulawayo.

Kraigg Brathwaite has featured in the Ultimate Team in 4 of his last 5 Tests. Against Zimbabwe, he has added 328 runs at 66 including the highest score of 182.

While Brathwaite (207 runs and a wicket) was the captain of the Ultimate Team in the opening Test, Tagenarine Chanderpaul (222 runs) was the vice-captain.

Aside from averaging 36 with the bat against Zimbabwe, Roston Chase has picked 5 wickets in 3 games.

By bagging 6 wickets in the first Test, Gukadesh Motie has become the third-highest wicket-taker in contemporary cricket for West Indies against Zimbabwe.

One double ton, four centuries and 15 fifties have been slammed in the last 3 Tests at Bulawayo.
